column4: it'd be appreciative if someone might be able to assist me with this issue, otherwise in about a half an hour i'll probably install another distribution, as ironically one of the only distributions boasting a dedicated laptop support team, doesnt suport my laptop, heh.
user list?
I though that's what this channel was for.
it would help if we knew what the problem is.
is your cd drive in some hotswap bay?
sorta?
state your laptop model and make.
iy you need to open your laptop to replace it, it's not hotswappable.
- it is also analagous to this american laptop: http://www.ecsusa.com/products/g220.html
this page does not state any useful information...
and I think I'm typing it on a very similar machine. }:>~
Have you tried expert mode?
- im doing that right now
let it autoprobe all modules.
disregard that one.
if you don't have floppy drive the installer will be trying to add floppy module every time it can.
i assume that's a bug as well, but probably already listed.
- perhaps it is not a bug.
wha?
it does that every time, I'm quite certain it was reported already
